verbose_text: Kanamycin interferes in translation (protein synthesis) processes and cell respiration, and causes potassium ion leakage, whereas Erythromycin inhibits protein synthesis by binding to the 50 S ribosome subunit, and rifampicin inhibits RNA synthesis by binding to beta-subunit of RNA polymerase.
evidence: rifampicin inhibits RNA synthesis by binding to beta-subunit of RNA polymerase
